item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: If we time travel back one year ago: - There was no hope for an Ethereum ETF - ETH staking was being classified as a security - ETH DeFi, Consensys, and builders were under intense scrutiny
NOW A STAKED ETH ETF WILL LIKELY BE APPROVED
Don't lose hope. ETH's Renaissance is here.
item.dc:creator: @Etherealize_io
item.description:
If we time travel back one year ago:
- There was no hope for an Ethereum ETF
- ETH staking was being classified as a security
- ETH DeFi, Consensys, and builders were under intense scrutiny

NOW A STAKED ETH ETF WILL LIKELY BE APPROVED

Don't lose hope. ETH's Renaissance is here.

item.title: RT by @fede_intern: Fun fact: I had my first call ever with him yesterday, and I was surprised at how strongly he believes in long-term collaboration and positive-sum games. He has 0 exposure in us and throughout the call he was trying to find ways to help us.
item.dc:creator: @shresth3103
item.description:
Fun fact: I had my first call ever with him yesterday, and I was surprised at how strongly he believes in long-term collaboration and positive-sum games. He has 0 exposure in us and throughout the call he was trying to find ways to help us.

item.title: RT by @fede_intern: Excited to see the development of Pod. Removing hard consensus with confirmation bounds for transactions, delivering low latency transactions

item.description: Excited to see the development of Pod. Removing hard consensus with confirmation bounds for transactions, delivering low latency transactions

item.title: R to @fede_intern: blog.lambdaclass.com/why-we-‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description: blog.lambdaclass.com/why-we-‚Ä¶

item.title:
As we did many times before, with @class_lambda, we like to show where we believe how the future will look like. We think that the work done by @poddotnetwork is impressive on theoretical and practical ways. We highly recommend everyone to learn about it and look at their research and work. This should be implementable in only a few thousands lines of code and it would be very useful in too many places in crypto and outside crypto.
Why we believe that Pod, an optimal-latency, censorship-free, and accountable generalized consensus layer, is a groundbreaking technology for blockchains and distributed systems
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description:
As we did many times before, with @class_lambda, we like to show where we believe how the future will look like. We think that the work done by @poddotnetwork is impressive on theoretical and practical ways. We highly recommend everyone to learn about it and look at their research and work. This should be implementable in only a few thousands lines of code and it would be very useful in too many places in crypto and outside crypto.

Why we believe that Pod, an optimal-latency, censorship-free, and accountable generalized consensus layer, is a groundbreaking technology for blockchains and distributed systems
